summary: Email correspondence from May 2019 between federal prosecutors and law enforcement regarding the transfer of FBI Florida's case files on Jeffrey Epstein to the Southern District of New York (SDNY) for copying as part of an ongoing investigation. The emails discuss logistics and coordination between offices.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the SDNY's open investigation, for whose case files are being requested from FBI Florida.

events.title: Initial Request for Epstein Case Files
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney from SDNY formally requests that FBI Florida ship all case files related to the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein to the SDNY for copying by a vendor.

events.title: Coordination on File Transfer
events.description: Follow-up emails indicate the case agent in Florida is supposed to be coordinating with the NY case agent to ship the investigative materials to SDNY.

events.title: Logistics Discussion for File Handling
events.description: Email discusses the preference for the files to be sent to the SDNY office to facilitate vendor access for copying, with an offer to join a call to explain.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) had an open investigation into Jeffrey Epstein as of May 2019, working in partnership with FBI New York.

SDNY prosecutors formally requested the complete case files from the prior FBI Florida investigation into Epstein to ensure they had all records for their investigation and future discovery obligations.
The requested materials included official case files and several boxes of agent work-product related to the Epstein investigation.
The plan was for a vendor to copy the files at the SDNY office before returning the originals to Florida.
The correspondence shows active inter-agency coordination (FBI Florida, FBI NY, SDNY) in the federal investigation preceding Epstein's July 2019 arrest.
